questions.Question: The World Environment Day is celebrated on -
questions.solution: Solution:		World Environment Day (WED) is celebrated annually on 5 June and is the United Nations principal vehicle for encouraging awareness and action for the protection of the environment. First held in 1974, it has been a platform for raising awareness on environmental issue such as marine pollution, human overpopulation, global warming, sustainable consumption and wildlife crime.

questions.Question: When is International Day of Reflection on the Genocide in Rwanda, recognized by the UN observed?
questions.solution: Solution:		On 7 April, UNESCO commemorates the International Day of Reflection on the 1994 Genocide against the Tutsi in Rwanda, which was established by the United Nations General Assembly in 2003. The date marks the beginning of the genocide perpetrated against members of the Tutsi minority by the Hutu extremist led government. Within just over 100 days, more than 1 million Tutsi were systematically murdered. Moderate Hutu and others who opposed the massacres were also killed during this period.

questions.Question: When is World Day for Cultural Diversity for Dialogue and Development, recognized by the UN observed?
questions.solution: Solution:		World Day for Cultural Diversity for Dialogue and Development is observed globally on 21 May every year. The day aims to celebrate the richness of the world's cultures and highlight the significance of its diversity as an agent of inclusion and positive change for achieving peace and sustainable development.

questions.Question: 15 October is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		15 October is Global Handwashing Day, a global advocacy day dedicated to increasing awareness and understanding about the importance of handwashing with soap as an effective and affordable way to prevent diseases and save lives.

questions.Question: 16 October is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		World Food Day is celebrated every year on 16 October to inspire people about healthy diets. On this day Food and Agriculture Organisation was established and launched by the United Nations in 1945.

questions.Question: 24 October is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		24 October has been celebrated as United Nations Day since 1948. In 1971, the United Nations General Assembly recommended that the day be observed by Member States as a public holiday.

questions.Question: 1 July is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		Every year, 1 July is celebrated as National Doctor's Day by the Indian Medical Association (IMA). The day is observed to commemorate the birth and death anniversary of former Bengal's Chief Minister Dr Bidhan Chandra Roy.

questions.Question: 2 July is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		World UFO Day is observed on 2 July. It was founded by the UFO hunter Haktan Akdogan. The first World UFO Day was celebrated in 2001 and spread awareness among people to gaze at the heavens scanning for unidentified flying objects.

questions.Question: 11 July is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		World Population Day is observed globally on 11 July every year.

questions.Question: 12 July is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		12 July is dedicated to celebrating Malala Yousafzai, the young activist from Pakistan. Malala was shot at by Taliban insurgents while she was on her way to school in 2012. Later, the United Nations declared 12 July, Malala's birthday, as World Malala Day in honour of the young education activist.

questions.Question: 17 July is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		World Day for International Justice, also referred to as Day of International Criminal Justice or International Justice Day, is an international day celebrated throughout the world on 17 July as part of an effort to recognize the emerging system of international criminal justice.

questions.Question: 8 October is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		Indian Air Force Day is celebrated on 8 October all over India. On 8 October, 1932 Indian Air Force Day was established.

questions.Question: 9 October is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		World Postal Day is celebrated on 9 October every year to raise awareness among people about the role of the postal sector for people and businesses every day.

questions.Question: 10 October is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		World Mental Health Day is observed on 10 October every year to raise awareness about the scale of suicide around the world and the role that each of us can play to help in preventing it. This day is organised by the World Federation for Mental Health.

questions.Question: 11 October is celebrated as -
questions.optionC: International day of the Girl Child
questions.solution: Solution:		International Day of the Girl Child is an international observance day declared by the United Nations; it is also called the Day of Girls and the International Day of the Girl. 11 October, 2012, was the first Day of the Girl Child. The observation supports more opportunity for girls and increases awareness of gender inequality faced by girls worldwide based upon their gender.

questions.Question: 14 October is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		World Standards Day (or International Standards Day) is an international day celebrated internationally each year on 14 October. The day honours the efforts of the thousands of experts who develop voluntary standards within standards development organizations such as the American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME), International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC), International Ethics Standards Board for Accountants (IESBA), International Organization for Standardization (ISO), International Telecommunication Union (ITU), Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) and Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF).

questions.Question: Which of the following year is celebrated as International Year of Forests?

questions.Question: Which of the following year is celebrated as International Year of Sanitation?
questions.solution: Solution:		The year 2008 was declared the International Year of Sanitation by the United Nations in conjunction with the Water for Life Decade. The United Nations General Assembly has declared 2008 the International Year of Sanitation.

questions.Question: Which of the following days is celebrated as the International Labour Day?
questions.solution: Solution:		International Workers' Day, also known as Labour Day in most countries and often referred to as May Day, is a celebration of labourers and the working classes that is promoted by the international labour movement and occurs every year on 1 May.

questions.Question: When is World Maritime Day, recognized by the UN observed?
questions.solution: Solution:		The United Nations (UN), via the International Maritime Organization (IMO), created World Maritime Day to celebrate the international maritime industry's contribution towards the world's economy, especially in shipping. The event's date varies by year and country but it is always on the last week of September.

questions.Question: Non Resident Indians (NRI) Day is marked on :
questions.solution: Solution:		Non Resident Indian Day is a celebratory day observed on 9 January by the Republic of India to mark the contribution of the overseas Indian community towards the development of India.

questions.Question: World day to combat desertification and drought is observed on -
questions.solution: Solution:		The World Day to Combat Desertification and Drought is a United Nations observance celebrated each year on 17 June. Its purpose is to raise awareness of the presence of desertification and drought, highlighting methods of preventing desertification and recovering from drought. Each year's global celebration has a unique, novel emphasis that had not been developed previously.

questions.Question: When is International Day for the Eradication of Poverty, recognized by the UN observed?
questions.solution: Solution:		The International Day for the Eradication of Poverty is an international observance celebrated each year on 17 October throughout the world.

questions.Question: World Human Rights Day is observed on :
questions.solution: Solution:		Human Rights Day is observed by the international community every year on 10 December. It commemorates the day in 1948 the United Nations General Assembly adopted the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.

questions.Question: 26 July is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		Kargil Vijay Diwas is celebrated on 26 July every year in honour of the Kargil War's Heroes.

questions.Question: 28 July is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		World Hepatitis Day is observed annually on 28 July to generate an opportunity to step up national and international efforts on hepatitis. Also, this day make people aware of the hepatitis disease and its consequences in the life of the people suffering from it.

questions.Question: 29 July is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		Global Tiger Day is celebrated every year on 29 July as a way to raise awareness about this magnificent but endangered big cat.

questions.Question: 12 August is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		International Youth Day (IYD) is the brainchild of the United Nations, and was first celebrated on 12 August 2000, after the UN General Assembly passed a resolution accepting the recommendation made by the World Conference of Ministers Responsible for Youth in Lisbon in 1998.

questions.Question: 13th August is celebrated as
questions.solution: Solution:		Every year on 13 August Lefthanders Day is observed. It raises awareness about the problems and difficulties that left handed persons face.

questions.Question: The United Nations declared 1990 as the International Year of -
questions.optionC: Year of the Rights of Internally Displaced Persons in Colombia
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: 10 December is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		Human Rights Day is observed every year on 10 December — the day the United Nations General Assembly adopted, in 1948, the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR).

questions.Question: 15th December is celebrated as
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: 26 December is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		Boxing Day is celebrated on 26 December every year and is only celebrated in a few countries; mainly ones historically connected to the UK and in some European countries. Boxing Day is celebrated just a day after Christmas.

questions.Question: United Nations adopted a charter of Economic Rights in the year -
questions.solution: Solution:		The General Assembly adopted resolution 3281 containing the “Charter of Economic Rights and Duties of States” on 12 December 1974, by 115 votes to 6, with 10 abstentions.

questions.Question: In which year was the Indian Space Research Organization (ISRO) founded?
questions.solution: Solution:		Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO), Indian space agency, founded in 1969 to develop an independent Indian space program. Its headquarters are in Bangalore (Bengaluru). ISRO’s chief executive is a chairman, who is also chairman of the Indian government’s Space Commission and the secretary of the Department of Space.

questions.Question: When is World Day to Combat Desertification and Drought, recognized by the UN observed?
questions.solution: Solution:		17 June is observed as World Day To Combat Desertification And Drought.

questions.Question: When is International Museum Day observed?
questions.solution: Solution:		International Museum Day (IMD) is an international day held annually on or around 18 May, coordinated by the International Council of Museums (ICOM). The event highlights a specific theme which changes every year reflecting a relevant theme or issue facing museums internationally.

questions.Question: When is International Yoga Day celebrated?
questions.solution: Solution:		Recognizing its universal appeal, on 11 December 2014, the United Nations proclaimed 21 June as the International Day of Yoga.

questions.Question: World Population Day is observed on -
questions.solution: Solution:		World Population Day is an annual event, observed on 11 July every year, which seeks to raise awareness of global population issues. The event was established by the Governing Council of the United Nations Development Programme in 1989.

questions.Question: International Yoga Day is observed on -
questions.solution: No explanation is given for this questionLet's Discuss on Board

questions.Question: 26 November is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		Since 2015, the Constitution Day or the Samvidhan Diwas is celebrated on 26 November every year. The day, also called the National Law Day, commemorates the formal adoption of the Constitution of India by the Constituent Assembly on 26 November, 1949.

questions.Question: 1 December is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		The World AIDS Day is observed on 1 December each year globally. The day is observed to raise awareness among people towards the problem of AIDS and HIV, a disease that affects the immune system of the body.

questions.Question: 5 December is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		World Soil Day is observed on 5 December to raise awareness about the importance of soil, healthy ecosystems and human well - being. International Volunteers Day (IVD) mandated by the UN General Assembly, is held each year on 5 December.

questions.Question: 7 December is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		International Civil Aviation Day is observed on 7 December worldwide to raise awareness about its importance to the social and economic development of States and the role that ICAO plays in International air transport.

questions.Question: 9 December is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		International Anti-Corruption Day is observed on 9 December every year to highlight how corruption affects health, education, justice, democracy, prosperity, and development.

questions.Question: 23 May is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		World Turtle's Day has been celebrated on 23 May every year since 1990.

questions.Question: 17 May is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		World Telecommunication and Information Society Day is an international day proclaimed in November 2006 by the International Telecommunication Union Plenipotentiary Conference in Antalya, Turkey, to be celebrated annually on 17 May.

questions.Question: 24 May is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		Commonwealth Day is celebrated on the second Monday in the month of March every year. However, in India, another Commonwealth Day is also celebrated on May 24.

questions.Question: 31 May is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		World No Tobacco Day (WNTD) is observed around the world every year on 31 May. This yearly celebration informs the public on the dangers of using tobacco, the business practices of tobacco companies, what the World Health Organization (WHO) is doing to fight against the use of tobacco, and what people around the world can do to claim their right to health and healthy living and to protect future generations.

questions.Question: 5th June is celebrated as
questions.solution: Solution:		World Environment Day is celebrated on 5 June, annually to encourage awareness and environmental protection.

questions.Question: 20 August is being celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		World Mosquito Day is observed on 20 August every year to commemorate the British doctor, Sir Ronald Ross's discovery in 1897 that 'female mosquitoes transmit malaria between humans'.

questions.Question: 26 August is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		This day commemorates the passage of the 19th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution which granted the women right to vote. In 1971, the U.S. Congress officially recognized 26 August as Women's Equality Day.

questions.Question: 29 August is Celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		National Sports Day is celebrated on 29 August every year to honour the birthday of Dhyan Chand a field hockey player. National Sports Day is also known as Rashtriya Khel Diwas.

questions.Question: 29 September is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		World Heart Day is observed annually on 29 September. This day informs people about heart disease and stroke which is the world's leading cause of death.

questions.Question: 30th September is celebrated as
questions.solution: Solution:		International Translation Day is observed on September 30, every year on the feast of St. Jerome, the Bible translator who is an epitome and known as the patron saint of the translators. The day aims to celebrate the work of language translation professionals which facilitates dialogue, understanding, and cooperation, contributing to the development and strengthening of world peace and security.

questions.Question: 26 April is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		World Intellectual Property Day is observed annually on 26 April. The event was established by the World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO) in 2000 to "raise awareness of how patents, copyright, trademarks and designs impact on daily life" and "to celebrate creativity, and the contribution made by creators and innovators to the development of societies across the globe".

questions.Question: 29 April is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		In 1982 the Dance Committee of ITI founded International Dance Day to be celebrated every year on the 29 April, the birthday of Jean-Georges Noverre, creator of modern ballet.

questions.Question: 3 May is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		Every year Press Freedom Day or World Press Freedom Day is observed on 3 May to evaluate press freedom around the world and to pay tribute to journalists who have lost their lives in the exercise of their profession.

questions.Question: 12 May is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		International Nurses Day (IND) is an international day observed around the world on 12 May (the anniversary of Florence Nightingale's birth) of each year, to mark the contributions that nurses make to society.

questions.Question: 15 May is celebrated as -
questions.solution: Solution:		In 1993, the General Assembly decided in a resolution that 15 May of every year should be observed as The International Day of Families.

questions.Question: When is United Nations Day for Women's Rights and International Peace observed?
questions.solution: Solution:		United Nations Day for Women's Rights and International Peace is observed on 8 March.

questions.Question: When is the International Day for the Preservation of the Ozone Layer, recognized by the UN observed?
questions.solution: Solution:		In 1994, the United Nations General Assembly proclaimed 16 September the International Day for the Preservation of the Ozone Layer, commemorating the date of the signing, in 1987, of the Montreal Protocol on Substances that Deplete the Ozone Layer.

questions.Question: When is International Talk Like a Pirate Day observed?
questions.solution: Solution:		International Talk Like a Pirate Day is a parodic holiday created in 1995 by John Baur and Mark Summers, of Albany, Oregon, U. S., who proclaimed 19 September each year as the day when everyone in the world should talk like a pirate.

questions.Question: When is International Youth Day, recognized by the UN observed?
questions.solution: Solution:		In 1999, in its resolution 54/120, the General Assembly endorsed the recommendation made by the World Conference of Ministers Responsible for Youth that 12 August be declared International Youth Day.

questions.Question: When is International Day for the Remembrance of the Slave Trade and its Abolition, recognized by the UN observed?
questions.solution: Solution:		International Day for the Remembrance of the Slave Trade and its Abolition is commemorated on 23 August each year. This International Day is intended to inscribe the tragedy of the slave trade in the memory of all peoples.

questions.Question: The Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty came into force in -
questions.solution: Solution:		Opened for signature in 1968, the Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty entered into force in 1970. On 11 May 1995, the Treaty was extended indefinitely. A total of 191 States have joined the Treaty, including the five nuclear-weapon States.

questions.Question: In which year was the first world environment day observed?
questions.solution: Solution:		The day was first observed in 1974 in the city of Spokane in the USA. In 1972, the United Nations General Assembly established the World Environment Day on the first day of the Stockholm Conference on the Human Environment. Two years later, in 1974 the first WED was held with the theme "Only One Earth".

questions.Question: Hong Kong will be transferred to China in -
questions.solution: Solution:		The transfer of sovereignty over Hong Kong, commonly known as the handover of Hong Kong (shortened to the Handover and the Return in mainland China), was the formal passing of responsibility for the territory of Hong Kong from the United Kingdom to the People's Republic of China at midnight on 1 July 1997.

questions.Question: Which of the following year is celebrated as International Year of Biodiversity?
questions.solution: Solution:		The United Nations General Assembly declared 2010 as the International Year of Biodiversity.

questions.Question: Which of the following year is celebrated as International Year of the Potato?
questions.solution: Solution:		The year 2008 was declared the International Year of the Potato by the United Nations, noting that the potato is a staple food in the diet of the world's population, and affirming the need to focus world attention on the role that the potato can play in providing food security and eradicating poverty.
